data.question: What is the empirical formula of compound 1?
At what temperature was the crystal structure of compound 2 solved?
What type of coordination sphere does Fe(II) have in compound 1?
What is the space group of compound 3?
What causes the abrupt thermal hysteretic spin transitions in Hofmann-type compounds?
data.answer: The presence of two crystallographically independent Fe atoms or intermediate phases with a different space group.

data.question: What is the Fe/Au ratio in compound 1?
What is the effect of irradiation with green light at 10 K on compound 1?
data.answer: It causes a drastic increase of the magnetic signal, indicating a LS to HS photoconversion.

data.question: Why does compound 1 show a complete and abrupt spin transition with thermal hysteresis?
data.answer: Due to its unique 1D structure formed by chains of Fe(II) complexes linked through bridging [Au(CN)2]-.

data.question: How does the structure of compound 3 differ from compound 1?
data.answer: In compound 3, one of the three terminal 4-tBupy is replaced by a coordinating MeOH molecule.

data.question: What is the significance of the disorder of the methyl groups of the 4-tBupy ligands in compound 1?
data.answer: It may explain the steps in the spin transition due to order-disorder transitions.

data.question: What is the role of aurophilic interactions in the structure of compound 1?
data.answer: They lead to double chains by linking the Au from bridging and terminal [Au(CN)2]- from neighboring chains.
